avatar.name: Silas Pahlavan
avatar.status: Approaching stream-entry; intellectual mastery of Eastern philosophy without experiential breakthrough

physical.appearance: Early-to-mid 40s; oval face with sharp nose and well-defined jawline; dark brown hair and beard with gray streaks; blue eyes behind gold-framed glasses; rumpled academic dress
physical.recognition_marker: Preternatural stillness under pressure; patience that borders on unnatural; automatic orientation toward others' distress

psychology.core_flaw_manifestation: Compulsive helping expressed through academic mentorship and crisis intervention. Runs toward Stewart's breakdown without hesitation. Offers 'limitless patience' to struggling students. Positions himself as the calm center others orbit. His identity is constructed around being the one who understands, who guides, who saves.
psychology.fatal_flaw: Compulsive helpingâattachment to being the fixer. His helper identity reinforces the sense of separate self, which is the actual obstacle to stream-entry. He cannot release the self that helps.
strengths: Deep intellectual understanding of non-dual philosophy
Physical and emotional composure under pressure
Capacity for insight when conditions align
Openness to experience beyond conceptual framework
weaknesses: Intellectual understanding substituting for direct experience
Ritual affirmation ('I am boundless awareness') as security blanket rather than pointer
May mistake conceptual clarity for actual liberation

chapter_arc.opening_state: Secure in his practice and self-concept; treats Lilith's past-life claims as 'metaphysical pillow talk'âintellectually engaging but not existentially threatening
chapter_arc.inciting_incident: Stewart's breakdown in the lecture hall. The student's cry of 'I am not that!' collides with Silas's teaching of 'Tat tvam asi' (That thou art), catalyzing genuine inquiry rather than academic discussion
chapter_arc.climax: In Lilith's flat, the meditation practice triggers direct past-life experienceânot concept but memory. Numb fingers, blood taste, foreign whispers. He recognizes Lilith's face across lifetimes. The intellectual framework cracks open into lived reality.
chapter_arc.closing_state: Destabilized but not yet transformed. His mantra fails him ('I am boundless...' He couldn't finish). Lilith deflects with 'You're still adjusting' and exits on a phone call. He stands at the threshold of stream-entry, outcome uncertain.

lesson_development.what_remains_unbroken: Chapter ends before stream-entry. He has glimpsed the territory but not crossed. The cliffhanger: can he release the final attachment to self-concept, or will Lilith's decade of positioning succeed in derailing him?
